title: Create and switch to new branch
Create new feature branch
content:
1. git checkout main  # Switch to main branch
2. git pull origin main  # Update local main
3. git checkout -b feature/new-feature  # Create and switch to feature branch
3.1 implement features ...
4. git push -u origin feature/new-feature  # Push branch to remote

title: Push local project to new GitHub repo (with README)
content:
1. cd /path/to/your/project  (Go to your project folder)
2. git init  (Initialize git repository)
3. git add .  (Stage all files)
4. git commit -m "Initial commit"  (Commit files)
5. git branch -M main  (Rename current branch to main)
6. git remote add origin https://github.com/username/new-repo.git  (Add remote repo)
7. git pull origin main --allow-unrelated-histories  (Merge remote README if exists)
8. git push -u origin main  (Push local project to GitHub)

title: Push changes to remote branch
content:
1. cd /path/to/your/project – Go to project folder
2. git status – Check modified files
3. git add . – Stage all changes
4. git commit -m "Your commit message" – Commit changes
5. git push origin your-branch – Push changes to the corresponding remote branch

If this is the first push of this branch, use:
git push -u origin your-branch

title: Delete a branch safely
content:
1. git checkout main  (Switch to a different branch)
2. git branch -d feature/new-feature  (Delete local branch if merged)
   git branch -D feature/new-feature  (Force delete if not merged)
3. git push origin --delete feature/new-feature  (Delete remote branch)
4. git fetch -p  (Prune deleted remote-tracking branches)
